central cell, with the circumambient cell laid open <s>by</s>
on either side of it; and the cells of successive zones, with their
communications:- 30 diam.
5. portion of the outer edge of a concentric zone, show-
ing itsmarginal pores:- 30 diam.
6. Portion of the inner margin of a part of the zone that
surrounded the preceding, detached from it by a fracture along
the line of their junction; showing the incompleteness of the
<s>enclosure of the cells</s> cell-partitions on that side:- 30 diam.
7. Portion of the margin of a disk with large columnar
cells (some of <s>which are</s> them partially <s>up</s> abra<s>i</s>ded at their extre-
mities), and with two rows of marginal pores:- 30 diam.
8. Monstrosity formed by the inclusion of a young disk
within the outer zones of an older one, that seem<s>s</s> to have
been brought into contact with it by the progressive increase
of its own diameter:- 25 diam.
9. Small <s>simple</s> fossil disk, from the Calcaire Grossier; show-
ing an exact conformity to the simple type of the recent
species:- 25 diam.
